units.title: Unit 1 Guidebook
units.description: Explore grammar tips and key phrases for this unit

sections.title: Gender
sections.description: In French, all nouns are either masculine or feminine. Masculine nouns use un, and feminine nouns use une.

sections.title: I think, therefore...
sections.description: In English, we say 'I am' but you are. In French, you do the same thing!

units.title: Unit 2 Guidebook
units.description: Further explore grammar and vocabulary for this unit

sections.title: Articles
sections.description: French articles may vary between definite, indefinite, and partitive.

sections.title: Negation
sections.description: French negation changes the verb phrase to express 'not'.

units.title: Unit 3 Guidebook
units.description: Deepen your understanding of French language structures.

sections.title: Possessive Adjectives
sections.description: Possessive adjectives change according to the gender and number of the noun they modify.

sections.title: Question Formation
sections.description: Learn different ways to form questions in French.

examples.French: Est-ce que tu aimes la pizza?

units.title: Unit 4 Guidebook
units.description: Expand your vocabulary and learn about French culture.

sections.title: Cultural Insights
sections.description: Discover aspects of French culture through language.

examples.French: La bise est une façon de saluer.
examples.English: The kiss is a way of greeting.

examples.French: Les repas en France sont souvent longs.
examples.English: Meals in France are often long.

examples.French: Le théâtre est populaire en France.
La mode est une partie importante de la culture française.
examples.English: Fashion is an important part of French culture.

examples.French: La fête nationale est le 14 juillet.

sections.title: Common Expressions
sections.description: Learn expressions commonly used in French conversation.

units.title: Unit 5 Guidebook
units.description: Master complex sentence structures and advanced grammar.

examples.French: Si j'avais su, j'aurais réagi différemment.
examples.English: If I had known, I would have reacted differently.

examples.French: Bien que je sois fatigué, je vais sortir.
examples.English: Although I am tired, I will go out.

examples.French: Elle parle comme si elle savait tout.
examples.English: She speaks as if she knew everything.

examples.French: Je viendrai pourvu que tu m'invites.
examples.English: I will come provided that you invite me.

examples.French: Après que nous avons mangé, nous avons pris un café.
examples.English: After we ate, we had a coffee.

sections.title: Subjunctive Mood
sections.description: Understand and use the subjunctive mood to express desires, doubts, and possibilities.

examples.French: Il faut que tu fasses tes devoirs.
examples.English: You need to do your homework.

examples.French: Je souhaite que vous veniez demain.
examples.English: I wish you would come tomorrow.

examples.French: Bien qu'il soit petit, il est fort.
examples.English: Although he is small, he is strong.

examples.French: Pour que la paix soit possible, il est nécessaire de communiquer.
examples.English: For peace to be possible, communication is necessary.
